You are given a list of $n$ integers, where each integer represents the size of a kangaroo.  

Kangaroos can be placed inside other kangaroos' pockets if the size of the larger kangaroo is at least twice the size of the smaller kangaroo.  

A kangaroo can only hold one other kangaroo, and a kangaroo inside a pocket cannot hold any other kangaroos.

Find the minimum number of kangaroos that will be visible (not inside a pocket) after arranging them in pockets.

You have a list of numbers representing the sizes of animals. Some animals can fit inside other animals if the bigger animal is at least twice the size of the smaller one.  Find the fewest number of animals that will be left outside without being inside another animal.
